conclusion: Plan to solve step-by-step to find temperature in state A
State A: p ≈ 3 × 10⁵ Pa, V ≈ 5 × 10⁻³ m³
State B: p ≈ 2 × 10⁵ Pa, V ≈ 5.5 × 10⁻³ m³
State C: p ≈ 5 × 10⁵ Pa, V ≈ 2 × 10⁻³ m³
Temperature at state C: T₃ = 300 K
Relation for constant mass: P₁V₁/T₁ = P₂V₂/T₂ = P₃V₃/T₃
Calculate T₁ using T₃ as reference: T₁ = (P₁ × V₁ × T₃) / (P₃ × V₃)
Substitute values: T₁ = (3 × 10⁵ Pa × 5 × 10⁻³ m³ × 300 K) / (5 × 10⁵ Pa × 2 × 10⁻³ m³)
Final answer: Temperature of gas in state A is 450 K
